column1: Dr. Manuel Ferraz de Campos Sales (Portuguese pronunciation: [manuˈew feˈʁas dʒi ˈkãpus ˈsalis]; 15 February 1841 – 28 June 1913) was a  Brazilian lawyer
column3: and politician who served as the fourth President of Brazil. He was born in the city of Campinas
column4: São Paulo. He graduated as a lawyer from the Faculdade de Direito do Largo de São Francisco
column6: in 1863. He served as a provincial deputy three times
column8: and also as minister of justice (1889-1891)
column9: senator and  governor of São Paulo (1896–1897). The pinnacle of his political career was his election as president of Brazil
column10: an office he held between 1898 and 1902. Austere financial reforms were adopted during his tenure.

column1: He died in São Paulo on 28 June 1913.
